name: sweph
description: The definitive Swiss Ephemeris bindings for Node.js
author: Timotej Valentin Rojko

scripts.preinstall: node -e "const fs = require('fs'); const { readdirSync, readFileSync, writeFileSync } = fs; try { if (!fs.existsSync('./src')) { fs.mkdirSync('./src', { recursive: true }); } if (!fs.existsSync('./src/functions')) { fs.mkdirSync('./src/functions', { recursive: true }); } let file = '#include <sweph.h>'; if (fs.existsSync('./src/functions')) { const files = readdirSync('./src/functions'); if (files.length > 0) { file = files.map((x,i) => readFileSync('./src/functions/' + x, 'utf8').replace(/args/g, 'args' + i).replace('#include <sweph.h>', '')).reduce((a,b) => a + b, '#include <sweph.h>'); } } writeFileSync('./src/functions.cpp', file, 'utf8'); } catch (err) { console.error('Warning during preinstall:', err.message); fs.writeFileSync('./src/functions.cpp', '#include <sweph.h>\n', 'utf8'); }"
scripts.test: node -e "const s = require('./'); const c = s.calc(2222222,0,4); console.log('OK')"
